meanings.definition: To receive and pass on (information or a message)
meanings.sent1: She was relaying the news to her friend over the phone.
meanings.sent2: The radio station was relaying the weather forecast to listeners.
meanings.sent3: The parrot was relaying messages between the two rooms.
meanings.sent4: The relay race was like relaying a baton of information from one runner to the next.
meanings.sent5: He was relaying the urgent message with great speed and accuracy.

meanings.definition: To broadcast or send out (a signal or message)
meanings.sent1: The lighthouse was relaying its beacon across the dark sea.
meanings.sent2: The satellite was relaying signals from space to the control center.
meanings.sent3: The old radio was relaying music from a bygone era.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like relaying warmth to everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The tower was relaying important messages to the entire city.

meanings.definition: To transfer (something) to another person or place
meanings.sent1: He was relaying the package to the courier for delivery.
meanings.sent2: The student was relaying the teacher's instructions to the rest of the class.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was relaying nuts to its hiding spot in the tree.
meanings.sent4: The river was like relaying life-giving water to the thirsty land.
meanings.sent5: She was relaying the secret code to her partner in the mission.
